g.text: Sketch map for delimiting individual contributions of human disturbances and climate
is the number of all the grid cells in the global land area, except the Antarctic. The rows in
represent the monthly attributes, while the columns represent the number of grid cells.
The names of vegetation types were designated by referring to the Koeppen classification
The existing vegetation types were classified based on climate and NDVI data using the
mean temperature, monthly total precipitation and monthly mean NDVI:
is monthly mean precipitation, NDVI is monthly
is the number of all the grid cells in the global land area, except
Temporal changes in the inﬂuences of human disturbance and
suggested that an interval of at least 15 years is
required to detect temporal changes in the geographical distribution of climate types. Thus,
the period from 1982 to 2013 was split into two periods (1982–1996 and 1997–2013), and
the existing and potential vegetation types were classified over the two periods to check the
temporal changes in the influences of human disturbance and climate change on vegetation
